newsitem.title: PERU: Peruvian hostage siege to hit the movie screens.
newsitem.headline: Peruvian hostage siege to hit the movie screens.

text.p: Peruvian actors lined up by the dozen on Wednesday for a casting call for a movie version of the 85-day hostage crisis at the Japanese ambassador's home in Lima.

The real-life plot is a Hollywood scriptwriter's dream -- heavily-armed Marxist rebels, grenades strapped to their chests, blast into a lavish cocktail party and take all the guests hostage to demand freedom for 450 jailed comrades.
Director Leonidas Zegarra said he would start filming Los Otros Rehenes (The Other Hostages) next month with a cast of about 1,000 people and a budget of $1 million -- large by Peruvian standards.

About 70 people auditioned on Wednesday, said a representative for the film's producers, Carlos Leano. Hundreds of extras will be needed for the party scenes, and local actor Maesaka Yamasaki will play President Alberto Fujimori, said Zegarra.

As for the script, there is still one problem -- no one knows the ending. With negotiations to free the hostages making slow progress, Zegarra said he would have to wait to see the outcome of the crisis before finishing the film.
